result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph J. Howard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

of Appeal and Circuit Court Record by COA

Defendant Joseph J. Howard appeared by video means.   Attorney Steven W. Zaleski in court for Defendant Joseph J. Howard as appellant counsel.  Prosecuting Atty Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for State of Wisconsin.   Discussion held on defendants motion to withdraw.  Court advises defendant if Attorney Zaleski is allowed to withdraw, SPD will not appoint new counsel pursuant to letter dated July 21, 2017.  Joseph Howard heard.  Defendant states he is not giving up his right to counsel, requesting Attorney Zaleski be removed from the case.  Court informs defendant Public Defender will not appoint new counsel, he may obtain private counsel or let Attorney Zaleski remain on case.  Defendant heard.  Attorney Zaleski heard.  Attorney Zaleski will remain on the case.

Sentencing hearing on September 8, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
15 - photo of baggies of controlled substance

Defendant Joseph J. Howard in court, in custody with attorney William Andrew Mayer. Kurt F. Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. preliminary issues discussed; 1 day trial, no alternate; discussion on witnesses; sequestration ordered; State heard on discovery request from inmate; 9:00 recess; reconviene, 9:06 jury led in; jurors sworn; voir dire; 10:20 jurors sworn; 10:25 jurors led out; Court heard on side bars; State heard on preliminary matters; 10:31 recess taken; 10:47 reconviene; 10:50 jury led in; Court reviews preliminary jury instructions; 11:01 State opening statements; 11:05 Atty. Mayer opening statement; State calls Robert Deglow, s/t; witness excused; State calls Ryan Klavekoske, s/t; witness excused; 11:56 jury led out for lunch recess; 12:52 jury led in; State calls Lt. Terrence Gebhardt, s/t; witness excused; State calls David Hannon, s/t; witness excused; recess for State to speak with court officer; State rests 1:28; Atty. Mayer calls Dawn Rardon, s/t; witness excused; 1:32 jury led out; Atty. Mayer heard, Court instructs Def. on right to testify; Atty. Mayer heard on motion to dismiss; State opposes; Court denies motion; Court hands out preliminary jury instructions; 1:37 recess taken; 1:54 reconviene; Def. does not wish to testify; 2:00 jury led in; Defense resets; State has no rebuttal witnesses; 2:03 jury led out; jury instructions reviewed; recess taken; 2:32 reconviene; 2:34 jury led in; jury instructions reviewed; State closing arguments; Atty. Mayer closing arguments; State rebuttal; Court reviews final jury instructions; bailiffs sworn; 3:24 jury led out for deliberations; 4:00 jury questions; 4:03 recess;

(ke) 4:54 pm case recalled.  Jury brought in, verdict reached.  Court receives verdict, reads verdict - Jury finds guilty of count 1.  Court polls jury.  Atty. Klomberg and Atty. Mayer are satisfied.  Court excuses jury at 4:59 pm.  Atty. Klomberg moves for judgment on the verdict, Atty. Mayer heard.  Court grants judgment on the verdict.  Court will contact attorneys' offices tomorrow morning for scheduling.  Will be scheduled for sentencing hearing, Court does NOT order PSI.  Court makes record on photos of exhibit 15, no objection to replacing photos (2 photos, 1 front and one back) for exhibit 15.
Dodge County Detention Facility Inmate Request to Judge

(2:42) Defendant Joseph J. Howard in court, in custody with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. This is State's request for hearing - request to modify the charge; State files Second Amended Information; State heard on request; Atty. Mayer waives reading, does not object; Court grants request to amend the Information; witness lists discussed; Atty. Mayer heard on issues prior to trial; Def. does not wish to proceed pro se; State requests Ludwig hearing; Atty. Mayer heard on State's offer; Court questions Def.; Atty. Mayer heard on request for transcript from last motion hearing, CR will have by Monday (send to jail); Atty. Mayer will locate clothes for Def. for JT; State heard on probation search and how to present to jury; Atty. Mayer response; Def. remanded (3:00)

Defendant, Joseph J. Howard, in court, in custody with Attorney William Andrew Mayer.  Attorney Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties heard, state calls Diana Banes s/t, witnesses are sequestered,  tn'd direct by Atty Klomberg.  Cross by Atty Mayer.  Redirect by Atty Klomberg.  Recross by Atty Mayer.  Wns excused.  Recess @ 8:52.  Case recalled 8:57.  Officer Kevin Hall c/s/t.  Cross by Atty Mayer.  Redirect by Atty Klomberg.  Recross by Atty Mayer. Wns excused.  Det. Ryan Klavekoske c/s/t.  Exhibit list.  Cross by Atty Mayer.  Wns excused.  Lt. Det. Terrence Gebhardt c/s/t.  Cross by Atty Mayer.  Wns excused.  Agent Robert Deglow c/s/t.  Cross by Atty Mayer.  Wns excused.  Recess @ 9:40.  Agent Banes recalled.  Cross by Atty Mayer.  Redirect by Atty Klomberg.  Recross by Atty Mayer.  Wns excused.  Court heard.  Argument by Atty Mayer.  Court denies motion; finds reasonable grounds.  Court reviews Defense MIL:   #1 - granted, #2 -deal with later, #3 - granted (as to law enforcement), #4 - granted (court officer may be applicable), #5 - granted, #6 - granted, #7 - granted.
State's MIL:  #1 - w/holds decision at this point, #2 - previously addressed, #3 - granted, #4 - granted, #5 - granted, #6 - granted, #7 - granted, #8 - hearing before she testifies, #9 - granted, #10 - granted, #11 - civilian clothing, electronic security devices, #12 - dealt with, #13 - address at time Court deals with JI.  Court heard regarding inmate request.  Atty Mayer heard; gives DVD to security for Deft.

from Atty Mayer re: order on motion
State's mtn to limit issues for suppression hearing
Motion hearing on May 31, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Joseph J. Howard in court, in custody with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Mayer heard, status of case is unchanged, states Def. wishes to modify bail. Court heard regarding demand for speedy trial. Counsel heard, both prepared to proceed. Atty Mayer heard on modification of bail argument, requests modification of cash bail. Atty Klomberg heard, cash bail should remain. Atty Mayer heard on further argument. Ct. heard, finds cash bail is necessary, motion denied. Discussion held regarding motions filed/to be filed. Atty Klomberg heard, objects to new motions being filed. Ct. heard, will allow Atty Mayer until May 6th to file whatever motions/w/d any motions. State's motions in limine to be filed by May 6th also.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Jury trial on June 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: In-Person Status Conference on April 26, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Joseph J. Howard in court, in custody with attorney Bradley J Jansen.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant heard, would like another attorney appointed, Atty Jansen heard, Atty Klomberg heard, court heard, parties argue.  Atty Klomberg would like the court to address the issue regarding bail, state requests $10,000 cash bail, Atty Jansen heard.  Court finds cash bail necessary, court orders $10,000 cash bail, no drugs, no para, etc.  Court removes Atty Jansen as attorney.  Court removes the trial date.  In-Person Status Conference scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Bradley J Jansen appeared by phone means for Defendant Joseph J Howard. Prosecuting Atty Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for State of Wisconsin. Court heard, reviews case, will set for JT. Atty Klomberg heard on history of matter, requests motion hearing 35 days prior to JT. Parties scheduled. Atty Jansen heard regarding Def. being released prior to JT. Atty Klomberg heard regarding motion hearing be heard w/i 30 days of JT, no claim of surprise on 31st. Court heard, sets another motion hearing date, Atty Klomberg to get writ for Def.  Jury trial scheduled for April 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for March 31, 2016 at 02:00 pm.  Motion hearing scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Joseph J Howard in court, in custody with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke by phone.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim set. Court sets $1000 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
